# ACUTRACK DESIGN SYSTEM - QUICK REFERENCE GUIDE

## üöÄ **Latest Version: 1.0.92**

### **‚å®Ô∏è Select, Dropdown, MultiSelect ‚Äî Keyboard & highlight (v1.0.92)**
- **List keyboard navigation**: When the list is open, Arrow Up/Down move the highlighted option, Enter selects (or toggles in MultiSelect), Home/End jump to first/last. Focus stays on the trigger so typing works in typeable Select and searchable MultiSelect.
- **Tab / Shift+Tab**: Close list and move focus to next/previous focusable (no crawling through options). **Escape**: Close list and return focus to trigger.
- **No page scroll**: Arrow and list-navigation keys call `preventDefault()` at Dropdown Trigger and Content so the document does not scroll.
- **Keyboard highlight**: Option under keyboard focus uses the same background as hover. **Dropdown.Item** supports **`isHighlighted`** for listbox options. Options with semantic colors (success, warning, error, info) show the same colored background and text when keyboard-highlighted as on hover.

### **üî≤ Focus ring ‚Äî Single brand color (v1.0.92)**
- **Unified focus ring color**: All components use the same focus ring for consistency: **brand-orange** (light) and **dark-brand-orange** (dark). Aligns with industry practice of one recognizable focus indicator across the system.
- **Form controls**: Input, Textarea, NumberInput, Slider, SearchBar ‚Äî the **`color`** prop controls **border** and **focus border** only; the **focus ring** (visible ring when focused) is always brand-orange when `hasFocusRing` is true.
- **Other components**: Button (all variants), Link, Checkbox, ToggleSwitch, Select, MultiSelect, Dropdown, Popover, and other focusable components use the same brand focus ring.

### **üéØ Dropdown Height Controls**
- **Dropdown.Content**: New `maxHeight`, `minHeight`, and `height` props for full height control
- **Select/MultiSelect/Autocomplete**: Consistent `maxDropdownHeight` prop across all components
- **Automatic Scrollbar**: When `maxHeight` is set, vertical scrolling is automatically enabled
- **Industry Standard Default**: '15rem' (240px) - shows ~5-7 items before scroll
- **Unified API**: All dropdown-based components use the same height control pattern

### **üé® Dropdown Line Height Control (NEW)**
- **Dropdown.Content**: New `itemLineHeight` prop (`string | number`) for controlling line-height of dropdown items
- **Select/MultiSelect/Autocomplete**: Consistent `itemLineHeight` prop across all components
- **Flexible Values**: Supports unitless numbers (e.g., `1.2`, `2.0`) or pixel strings (e.g., `'10px'`, `'12px'`)
- **Dynamic Padding**: Padding automatically adjusts based on line-height value (minimal for compact, normal for default)
- **Vertical Alignment**: Text remains vertically centered with hover states, even with compact line-heights
- **Fixed Issues**: Resolved alignment and gap issues when using compact line-heights like `10px` or `1.2`

### **üéõÔ∏è ToggleSwitch Component Enhancements (NEW)**
- **Helper Text Position Control**: New `helperTextPosition` prop (`'top' | 'bottom' | 'right'`) for controlling helper text placement when `labelPosition="top"`
- **Label Styling Consistency**: Labels now use `font-semibold` (matching Input, Select, Textarea) instead of `font-medium`
- **Vertical Alignment Fix**: Labels are now properly centered vertically with toggle switches across all sizes
- **Comprehensive Test Page**: New dedicated test page with interactive examples for all variants, sizes, colors, and use cases

### **üîß Card Component Gradient CSS Fix**
- **Fixed CSS Build Issue**: Resolved template literal syntax appearing in built CSS instead of actual color values
- **Runtime Class Generation**: Custom gradients now use Tailwind JIT mode for dynamic class generation
- **Clean CSS Output**: No more template literal artifacts in the built CSS file

### **üõ†Ô∏è Test Page & Build Fixes**
- **Component Test Hub**: Fixed broken symlink, created proper HTML entry point
- **Web Manifest**: Created properly formatted JSON file to resolve browser syntax errors
- **Build Reliability**: Improved build process consistency

### **üéØ Icon-Only Button Improvements**
- **Icon Scaling**: Icons now automatically scale with button size variants (xs‚Üísm, sm‚Üímd, md‚Üílg, lg‚Üíxl, xl‚Üí2xl)
- **Square Padding**: Icon-only buttons use equal horizontal and vertical padding for visual balance
- **Loading State Spinners**: Optimized spinner sizes to match icon visual weight
  - Spinner sizes: xs/sm (w-3), md (w-4), lg (w-6), xl (w-8)
- **Consistent Dimensions**: Loading and normal states maintain same button size

### **üîß Dropdown/Select Sizing Enhancement (v1.0.71)**
- **Flexible Panel Width**: Dropdown and Select panels now use trigger `min-width` and expand to `max-content` for long option text
- **No Truncation**: Options with long text no longer get cut off or improperly wrapped
- **Better UX**: Panels adapt to content width while maintaining minimum trigger width

### **üé® Select/Dropdown Option Colors**
- **Per-Option Colors**: Each Select option can have its own color state via `color` prop
- **Supported Colors**: `primary` (default), `success`, `warning`, `info`, `danger`/`error`
- **Backward Compatible**: Both `danger` and `error` map to the same red error styling
- **Smart Hover States**: Hover backgrounds adapt to the selected color theme

### **üß≠ Sidebar Toggle Positioning**
- **New `togglePosition` Prop**: Control toggle button placement with `top`, `bottom`, or `none`
- **Sticky Positioning**: Toggle remains accessible with improved spacing and visual consistency
- **Works with `showToggleButton`**: Full control over toggle visibility and placement

### **üîÅ ToggleSwitch Handling + Label Position**
- **Controlled/Uncontrolled**: Uses `checked` when `onChange` provided, otherwise `defaultChecked`
- **No React Warnings**: Proper handling eliminates read-only field warnings
- **New `labelPosition="top"`**: Stack label above toggle switch for vertical layouts

### **üé® Industry Standard FileUploader Component**
- **Complete Refactor**: From 200+ props to clean API (~25 essential props)
- **Modern API**: `files`/`onFilesChange` pattern for consistency
- **Essential Features**: Validation, previews, progress, accessibility
- **Drag & Drop**: Enhanced functionality with visual feedback
- **File Validation**: Size limits, type restrictions, custom validation
- **File Previews**: Image thumbnails and file type icons
- **Accessibility**: Full keyboard navigation and screen reader support
- **Variants**: 4 options (default, outlined, filled, minimal)
- **Sizes**: 5 options (xs, sm, md, lg, xl)
- **Colors**: 5 themes (primary, success, warning, danger, info)
- **Test Page**: Comprehensive showcase of all features
- **Documentation**: Complete component guide with examples

### **üé® Industry Standard Card Component**
- **Sub-Components**: Card.Header, Card.Body, Card.Footer, Card.Title, Card.Description, Card.Actions, Card.Content, Card.Image, Card.Group
- **Background Colors**: 9 options including brand colors
- **Text Colors**: 12 options with smart auto-detection
- **Gradient Backgrounds**: 6 types including custom gradients
- **Animations**: 6 animation types (fadeIn, slideUp, slideDown, slideLeft, slideRight, scale)
- **Loading States**: Skeleton animation support
- **Image Support**: Multiple positions (top, bottom, left, right)
- **Accessibility**: Comprehensive ARIA attributes and keyboard navigation
- **Overflow Control**: `overflowVisible` prop for dropdown support

### **üéØ Unified Form Control Behavior**
- **Full-Width Consistency**: All form controls take full width of parent containers
- **Enhanced MultiSelect**: Checkbox support, descriptions, icons, and color adaptation
- **Improved Autocomplete**: State management with key-based reset for edit forms
- **Responsive Design**: Screen-friendly behavior across all devices

---

## üöÄ **Initial Setup Requirements**

### **Prerequisites**
- **Node.js**: 18.x or higher (supports React 18 & 19)
- **React**: 18.x or 19.x
- **Vite**: 5.x or higher
- **Tailwind CSS**: 3.x or higher

### **Quick Start (Copy-Paste Setup)**

#### **1. Create New Project**
```bash
npm create vite@latest my-app -- --template react-ts
cd my-app
```

#### **2. Install Dependencies**
```bash
npm install react react-dom
npm install -D @types/react @types/react-dom typescript
npm install -D tailwindcss postcss autoprefixer
npm install -D vite @vitejs/plugin-react
```

#### **3. Install Acutrack Design System**
```bash
npm install @acutrack-bookprint/acutrack-ds@^1.0.72
```

#### **4. Configure Tailwind CSS**
```bash
npx tailwindcss init -p
```

**`tailwind.config.js`:**
```javascript
/** @type {import('tailwindcss').Config} */
export default {
  content: [
    "./index.html",
    "./src/**/*.{js,ts,jsx,tsx}",
    "./node_modules/@acutrack-bookprint/acutrack-ds/**/*.{js,ts,jsx,tsx}"
  ],
  theme: {
    extend: {
      colors: {
        'brand-orange': '#FF6B35',
        'brand-navy': '#1B3B6F',
        'bg-primary': '#FFFFFF',
        'bg-secondary': '#F8F9FA',
        'bg-tertiary': '#E9ECEF',
        'text-primary': '#212529',
        'text-secondary': '#6C757D',
        'border-color': '#DEE2E6',
        'system-success': '#28A745',
        'system-warning': '#FFC107',
        'system-error': '#DC3545',
        'system-info': '#17A2B8',
        'dark-bg-primary': '#1A1A1A',
        'dark-bg-secondary': '#2D2D2D',
        'dark-bg-tertiary': '#404040',
        'dark-text-primary': '#FFFFFF',
        'dark-text-secondary': '#B0B0B0',
        'dark-border-color': '#404040',
        'dark-brand-orange': '#FF8A65'
      }
    },
  },
  plugins: [],
  darkMode: 'class'
}
```

#### **5. Setup CSS**
**`src/index.css`:**
```css
@tailwind base;
@tailwind components;
@tailwind utilities;

/* Import Acutrack Design System styles */
@import '@acutrack-bookprint/acutrack-ds/dist/style.css';
```

#### **6. Configure Vite**
**`vite.config.ts`:**
```typescript
import { defineConfig } from 'vite'
import react from '@vitejs/plugin-react'

export default defineConfig({
  plugins: [react()],
  resolve: {
    alias: {
      '@': '/src'
    }
  }
})
```

#### **7. Example App.tsx**
```tsx
import React, { useState } from 'react'
import { 
  Button, 
  Card, 
  Header, 
  Container, 
  Grid,
  ThemeToggle 
} from '@acutrack-bookprint/acutrack-ds'

function App() {
  const [theme, setTheme] = useState<'light' | 'dark'>('light')

  const toggleTheme = () => {
    const newTheme = theme === 'light' ? 'dark' : 'light'
    setTheme(newTheme)
    document.documentElement.classList.toggle('dark')
  }

  return (
    <div className="min-h-screen bg-bg-primary dark:bg-dark-bg-primary">
      <Header 
        variant="dashboard"
        hasThemeToggle={true}
        theme={theme}
      />
      
      <Container size="lg" padding="lg">
        <Grid cols={{ xs: 1, sm: 1, md: 2, lg: 3 }} gap={6}>
          <Card variant="elevated" color="primary">
            <Card.Header>
              <Card.Title>Welcome!</Card.Title>
              <Card.Description>Your Acutrack Design System is ready to use.</Card.Description>
            </Card.Header>
            <Card.Body>
              <p>Start building with industry-standard components.</p>
            </Card.Body>
          </Card>
          
          <Card variant="bordered" backgroundColor="brand-orange">
            <Card.Header>
              <Card.Title className="text-white">Components</Card.Title>
            </Card.Header>
            <Card.Body>
              <Card.Actions>
                <Button variant="primary" className="bg-white text-brand-orange">
                  Primary Button
                </Button>
              </Card.Actions>
            </Card.Body>
          </Card>
          
          <Card variant="minimal" gradient="primary-to-secondary">
            <Card.Header>
              <Card.Title className="text-white">Theme</Card.Title>
            </Card.Header>
            <Card.Body>
              <ThemeToggle 
                theme={theme} 
                onThemeChange={toggleTheme}
              />
            </Card.Body>
          </Card>
        </Grid>
      </Container>
    </div>
  )
}

export default App
```

#### **8. Complete package.json**
```json
{
  "name": "my-app",
  "private": true,
  "version": "0.0.0",
  "type": "module",
  "scripts": {
    "dev": "vite",
    "build": "tsc && vite build",
    "lint": "eslint . --ext ts,tsx --report-unused-disable-directives --max-warnings 0",
    "preview": "vite preview"
  },
  "dependencies": {
    "@acutrack-bookprint/acutrack-ds": "^1.0.72",
    "react": "^18.2.0",
    "react-dom": "^18.2.0"
  },
  "devDependencies": {
    "@types/react": "^18.2.43",
    "@types/react-dom": "^18.2.17",
    "@typescript-eslint/eslint-plugin": "^6.14.0",
    "@typescript-eslint/parser": "^6.14.0",
    "@vitejs/plugin-react": "^4.2.1",
    "autoprefixer": "^10.4.16",
    "eslint": "^8.55.0",
    "eslint-plugin-react-hooks": "^4.6.0",
    "eslint-plugin-react-refresh": "^0.4.5",
    "postcss": "^8.4.32",
    "tailwindcss": "^3.3.6",
    "typescript": "^5.2.2",
    "vite": "^5.0.8"
  }
}
```

### **Verification Steps**
1. **Run the app**: `npm run dev`
2. **Check components render**: Should see Header, Cards, and Grid
3. **Test theme toggle**: Should switch between light/dark modes
4. **Check responsiveness**: Resize browser to see responsive behavior

### **Key Setup Points**
- ‚úÖ **Tailwind CSS**: Required for all styling
- ‚úÖ **CSS Import**: Must import DS styles in index.css
- ‚úÖ **Theme Colors**: Extended color palette in tailwind.config.js
- ‚úÖ **Content Paths**: Include DS node_modules in Tailwind content
- ‚úÖ **Dark Mode**: Configured as 'class' for theme switching

### **Troubleshooting**
- **Components not styled**: Check CSS import and Tailwind config
- **Theme not working**: Ensure darkMode: 'class' in Tailwind config
- **Build errors**: Verify React version compatibility (18.x or 19.x)
- **Missing colors**: Check extended color palette in Tailwind config

### **Layout Issues Root Cause Analysis**

**Common Problem**: Components not displaying properly or layout inconsistencies.

**Root Cause Analysis Method**:

1. **Identify the Issue**:
   - Component not visible
   - Layout misalignment
   - Responsive behavior problems
   - Styling inconsistencies

2. **Check Implementation vs Design System**:
   ```tsx
   // ‚ùå PROBLEMATIC - Custom CSS overrides
   <div className="max-w-md mx-auto">  // Custom container
     <Card variant="elevated" size="lg">  // Design system component (working fine)
       // Form content
     </Card>
   </div>

   // ‚úÖ CORRECT - Using design system Grid
   <Grid cols={{ xs: 1, lg: 2 }} gap={6}>  // Design system component
     <Card variant="elevated" size="lg">  // Design system component
       // Form content
     </Card>
   </Grid>
   ```

3. **Component Performance Analysis**:
   | Component | Status | Issue Source |
   |-----------|--------|--------------|
   | `Grid` | ‚úÖ Perfect | Not used initially |
   | `Card` | ‚úÖ Perfect | Used correctly |
   | `Input` | ‚úÖ Perfect | Used correctly |
   | `Button` | ‚úÖ Perfect | Used correctly |
   | `Container` | ‚úÖ Perfect | Used correctly |
   | **Custom Layout Code** | ‚ùå Problem | **Implementation mistake** |

4. **Solution Strategy**:
   - **Remove custom CSS**: Eliminate custom containers and styling
   - **Use design system components**: Leverage Grid, Container, and other layout components
   - **Follow established patterns**: Use the same structure as working forms/components
   - **Test responsiveness**: Ensure proper behavior across all screen sizes

5. **Prevention Tips**:
   - Always use design system components for layout
   - Avoid custom CSS overrides
   - Follow established patterns from working examples
   - Test on multiple screen sizes
   - Use the design system's responsive utilities

**Key Takeaway**: Our design system components work perfectly when used correctly. Layout issues are typically caused by custom implementation choices that conflict with the design system's intended usage patterns.

### **No Native Styles Policy**
‚ö†Ô∏è **Important**: This design system has **NO native styles**. All styling comes from:
- Tailwind CSS classes
- Custom CSS variables
- Component-specific styles

**Never use**: `style={{}}`, `className="bg-red-500"`, or inline styles.
**Always use**: Tailwind classes and DS component props.

---

## üé® **Iconography System**

### **Icon Usage Pattern**
The Acutrack Design System uses **Google Material Icons** with a consistent implementation pattern:

#### **Basic Icon Usage**
```tsx
import { Icon } from '@acutrack-bookprint/acutrack-ds'

// Simple icon
<Icon>search</Icon>

// Icon with custom size
<Icon className="w-6 h-6">home</Icon>

// Icon with custom color
<Icon className="text-blue-500">info</Icon>
```

#### **Icon in Components**
```tsx
// Button with left icon
<Button leftIcon={<Icon>add</Icon>}>
  Add Item
</Button>

// Button with right icon
<Button rightIcon={<Icon>arrow_forward</Icon>}>
  Continue
</Button>

// Input with right icon
<Input 
  rightIcon={<Icon>search</Icon>}
  placeholder="Search..."
/>
```

#### **Icon Sizing Guidelines**
```tsx
// Consistent sizing across components
<Icon className="w-4 h-4">   // xs - Small components
<Icon className="w-5 h-5">   // sm - Default size
<Icon className="w-6 h-6">   // md - Medium components
<Icon className="w-8 h-8">   // lg - Large components
<Icon className="w-10 h-10"> // xl - Extra large
```

#### **Icon Color System**
```tsx
// Use semantic colors
<Icon className="text-system-success">check_circle</Icon>
<Icon className="text-system-warning">warning</Icon>
<Icon className="text-system-error">error</Icon>
<Icon className="text-system-info">info</Icon>

// Use brand colors
<Icon className="text-brand-orange">star</Icon>
<Icon className="text-brand-navy">favorite</Icon>

// Use theme colors
<Icon className="text-text-primary dark:text-dark-text-primary">home</Icon>
```

#### **Common Icon Names**
```tsx
// Navigation
<Icon>home</Icon>
<Icon>menu</Icon>
<Icon>arrow_back</Icon>
<Icon>arrow_forward</Icon>

// Actions
<Icon>add</Icon>
<Icon>edit</Icon>
<Icon>delete</Icon>
<Icon>save</Icon>
<Icon>close</Icon>

// Status
<Icon>check_circle</Icon>
<Icon>warning</Icon>
<Icon>error</Icon>
<Icon>info</Icon>

// UI Elements
<Icon>search</Icon>
<Icon>filter_list</Icon>
<Icon>sort</Icon>
<Icon>more_vert</Icon>
<Icon>settings</Icon>
```

#### **Icon in Form Components**
```tsx
// Checkbox with icon
<Checkbox 
  label="Accept terms"
  leftIcon={<Icon>check_box</Icon>}
/>

// Radio with icon
<Radio 
  label="Option 1"
  leftIcon={<Icon>radio_button_checked</Icon>}
/>

// Toggle with icon
<ToggleSwitch 
  label="Notifications"
  leftIcon={<Icon>notifications</Icon>}
/>
```

#### **Icon in Data Components**
```tsx
// Table with icons
<Table>
  <thead>
    <tr>
      <th><Icon>person</Icon> Name</th>
      <th><Icon>email</Icon> Email</th>
      <th><Icon>phone</Icon> Phone</th>
    </tr>
  </thead>
</Table>

// Card with icon
<Card>
  <CardHeader>
    <Icon className="text-brand-orange">star</Icon>
    <h3>Featured Content</h3>
  </CardHeader>
</Card>
```

#### **Icon Animation**
```tsx
// Animated icons
<Icon className="animate-spin">refresh</Icon>
<Icon className="animate-pulse">notifications</Icon>
<Icon className="animate-bounce">arrow_upward</Icon>

// Hover effects
<Icon className="hover:scale-110 transition-transform">favorite</Icon>
<Icon className="hover:rotate-180 transition-transform">expand_more</Icon>
```

#### **Icon Accessibility**
```tsx
// Icons with labels for screen readers
<Icon aria-label="Search">search</Icon>
<Icon aria-label="Close dialog">close</Icon>

// Decorative icons (hidden from screen readers)
<Icon aria-hidden="true">decorative_icon</Icon>
```

#### **Icon Best Practices**
1. **Consistent Sizing**: Use standard size classes across components
2. **Semantic Colors**: Use system colors for status and feedback
3. **Accessibility**: Provide aria-labels for functional icons
4. **Performance**: Icons are lightweight and don't impact bundle size
5. **Theme Support**: Icons automatically adapt to light/dark themes

#### **Icon Troubleshooting**
- **Icon not showing**: Check icon name spelling (use exact Material Icon names)
- **Wrong size**: Ensure className includes width and height
- **Color issues**: Verify Tailwind color classes are properly configured
- **Accessibility**: Add aria-labels for screen reader support

## üé® **Card Component System (v1.0.68)**

### **Industry Standard Card Structure**
The Card component now follows industry standards with semantic sub-components:

#### **Basic Card Usage**
```tsx
import { Card } from '@acutrack-bookprint/acutrack-ds'

// Simple card (backward compatible)
<Card>
  <h3>Title</h3>
  <p>Content goes here</p>
</Card>

// Industry standard structure (recommended)
<Card>
  <Card.Header>
    <Card.Title>Card Title</Card.Title>
    <Card.Description>Card description</Card.Description>
  </Card.Header>
  <Card.Body>
    <p>Main content area</p>
  </Card.Body>
  <Card.Footer>
    <Card.Actions>
      <Button>Action</Button>
    </Card.Actions>
  </Card.Footer>
</Card>
```

#### **Card Variants**
```tsx
// Default - subtle shadow, no border
<Card variant="default">Content</Card>

// Minimal - transparent background
<Card variant="minimal">Content</Card>

// Elevated - prominent shadow
<Card variant="elevated">Content</Card>

// Bordered - clear border definition
<Card variant="bordered">Content</Card>

// Filled - background color
<Card variant="filled">Content</Card>

// Outlined - transparent with border
<Card variant="outlined">Content</Card>

// Ghost - hover effects
<Card variant="ghost">Content</Card>

// Card - standard with shadow and border
<Card variant="card">Content</Card>

// Panel - panel-style appearance
<Card variant="panel">Content</Card>
```

#### **Card Colors**
```tsx
// Border colors
<Card color="primary">Primary border</Card>
<Card color="success">Success border</Card>
<Card color="warning">Warning border</Card>
<Card color="danger">Danger border</Card>
<Card color="info">Info border</Card>
<Card color="neutral">Neutral border (default)</Card>

// Background colors
<Card backgroundColor="brand-orange">
  <Card.Title className="text-white">Orange Background</Card.Title>
</Card>

<Card backgroundColor="brand-navy">
  <Card.Title className="text-white">Navy Background</Card.Title>
</Card>

<Card backgroundColor="success">
  <Card.Title className="text-white">Success Background</Card.Title>
</Card>
```

#### **Card Sizes**
```tsx
<Card size="xs">Extra small</Card>
<Card size="sm">Small</Card>
<Card size="md">Medium (default)</Card>
<Card size="lg">Large</Card>
<Card size="xl">Extra large</Card>
<Card size="2xl">2X large</Card>
<Card size="full">Full size</Card>
```

#### **Advanced Card Features**
```tsx
// Loading state
<Card loading={true}>
  <Card.Title>Loading Content</Card.Title>
</Card>

// Image support
<Card 
  imageSrc="/path/to/image.jpg"
  imagePosition="top"
  imageSize="lg"
>
  <Card.Header>
    <Card.Title>Card with Image</Card.Title>
  </Card.Header>
</Card>

// Gradient backgrounds
<Card gradient="brand-orange-to-brand-navy">
  <Card.Title className="text-white">Gradient Card</Card.Title>
</Card>

// Animations
<Card 
  animation="slideUp"
  animationDelay={200}
>
  <Card.Title>Animated Card</Card.Title>
</Card>

// Overflow control for dropdowns
<Card overflowVisible={true}>
  <Select options={options} />
</Card>
```

#### **Card Groups**
```tsx
// Horizontal group
<Card.Group direction="horizontal" gap="lg">
  <Card size="sm">Card 1</Card>
  <Card size="sm">Card 2</Card>
  <Card size="sm">Card 3</Card>
</Card.Group>

// Grid group
<Card.Group direction="grid" columns={3} gap="md">
  <Card>Grid Card 1</Card>
  <Card>Grid Card 2</Card>
  <Card>Grid Card 3</Card>
</Card.Group>

// Vertical group
<Card.Group direction="vertical" gap="sm">
  <Card>Vertical Card 1</Card>
  <Card>Vertical Card 2</Card>
</Card.Group>
```

#### **Card Accessibility**
```tsx
// With ARIA attributes
<Card 
  ariaLabel="User dashboard card"
  role="region"
>
  <Card.Header>
    <Card.Title>Dashboard</Card.Title>
  </Card.Header>
</Card>

// Semantic heading levels
<Card>
  <Card.Header>
    <Card.Title as="h1">Main Heading</Card.Title>
    <Card.Description>Page description</Card.Description>
  </Card.Header>
</Card>
```

#### **Card Best Practices**
1. **Use semantic structure**: Always use Card.Header, Card.Body, Card.Footer
2. **Choose appropriate variants**: Use elevated for important content, minimal for subtle content
3. **Handle overflow**: Use `overflowVisible={true}` for dropdowns and popovers
4. **Provide accessibility**: Include ARIA attributes and proper heading levels
5. **Use loading states**: Show skeleton loading for better UX
6. **Leverage colors**: Use background colors and gradients for visual hierarchy

## üì± **Responsive Design System**

### **Breakpoint System**
```tsx
// Mobile-first responsive design
cols={{ xs: 1, sm: 2, md: 3, lg: 4, xl: 6 }}

// Breakpoint mapping
xs: 0px+      (mobile)
sm: 640px+    (small tablets)
md: 768px+    (tablets)
lg: 1024px+   (desktops)
xl: 1280px+   (large desktops)
```

### **Responsive Components**
```tsx
// Grid with responsive columns
<Grid cols={{ xs: 1, sm: 2, md: 3, lg: 4 }} gap={6}>
  <Card>Content 1</Card>
  <Card>Content 2</Card>
  <Card>Content 3</Card>
  <Card>Content 4</Card>
</Grid>

// Container with responsive sizing
<Container 
  size="screen"
  padding={{ xs: 'sm', sm: 'md', md: 'lg', lg: 'xl' }}
>
  Content adapts to screen size
</Container>

// Layout with responsive behavior
<TwoColumnLayout gap={{ xs: 'sm', sm: 'md', md: 'lg' }}>
  <Sidebar>Navigation</Sidebar>
  <Main>Content</Main>
</TwoColumnLayout>
```

---

## üîß **Form Components (v1.0.71)**

### **Select Component - Option Colors**
Enhanced with per-option color support:

```tsx
import { Select } from '@acutrack-bookprint/acutrack-ds'

// Select with colored options
<Select
  label="Action Type"
  id="action-type"
  options={[
    { value: 'create', label: 'Create', color: 'success' },
    { value: 'update', label: 'Update', color: 'primary' },
    { value: 'delete', label: 'Delete', color: 'danger' }, // or 'error'
    { value: 'warning', label: 'Warning', color: 'warning' },
    { value: 'info', label: 'Information', color: 'info' }
  ]}
  value={selectedAction}
  onChange={setSelectedAction}
/>

// Color options: 'primary', 'success', 'warning', 'info', 'danger'/'error'
// Both 'danger' and 'error' work identically for backward compatibility
```

### **Dropdown Component - Option Colors**
Dropdown items also support state-based colors:

```tsx
import { Dropdown } from '@acutrack-bookprint/acutrack-ds'

<Dropdown>
  <Dropdown.Trigger>Actions</Dropdown.Trigger>
  <Dropdown.Content>
    <Dropdown.Item onSelect={handleEdit}>Edit</Dropdown.Item>
    <Dropdown.Item onSelect={handleDuplicate} isSuccess>Duplicate</Dropdown.Item>
    <Dropdown.Item onSelect={handleDelete} isError>Delete</Dropdown.Item>
    <Dropdown.Item onSelect={handleWarning} isWarning>Warning Action</Dropdown.Item>
    <Dropdown.Item onSelect={handleInfo} isInfo>Info Action</Dropdown.Item>
  </Dropdown.Content>
</Dropdown>
```

### **ToggleSwitch Component - Label Position**
Enhanced with flexible label positioning:

```tsx
import { ToggleSwitch } from '@acutrack-bookprint/acutrack-ds'

// Label on top (new!)
<ToggleSwitch
  id="notifications-top"
  label="Enable Notifications"
  labelPosition="top"
  isChecked={notifications}
  onChange={(e) => setNotifications(e.target.checked)}
/>

// Label on left
<ToggleSwitch
  id="notifications-left"
  label="Enable Notifications"
  labelPosition="left"
  isChecked={notifications}
  onChange={(e) => setNotifications(e.target.checked)}
/>

// Label on right (default)
<ToggleSwitch
  id="notifications-right"
  label="Enable Notifications"
  isChecked={notifications}
  onChange={(e) => setNotifications(e.target.checked)}
/>

// Uncontrolled mode (uses defaultChecked)
<ToggleSwitch
  id="auto-save"
  label="Auto-save"
  defaultChecked={true}
/>
```

### **Select Component - Flexible Panel Sizing**
Select and Dropdown panels now handle long text properly:

```tsx
import { Select } from '@acutrack-bookprint/acutrack-ds'

// Long option text automatically expands panel
<Select
  label="Select Long Option"
  id="long-options"
  options={[
    { value: '1', label: 'This is a very long option name that needs more space' },
    { value: '2', label: 'Short option' },
    { value: '3', label: 'Another extremely long option name that should not be truncated' }
  ]}
  value={selectedValue}
  onChange={setSelectedValue}
/>
// Panel automatically expands to fit content, minimum width matches trigger
```

### **MultiSelect Component**
Enhanced with industry-standard features:

```tsx
import { MultiSelect } from '@acutrack-bookprint/acutrack-ds'

// Basic usage
<MultiSelect
  options={[
    { value: 'react', label: 'React', icon: 'code' },
    { value: 'vue', label: 'Vue.js', icon: 'code' },
    { value: 'angular', label: 'Angular', icon: 'code' }
  ]}
  value={selectedValues}
  onChange={setSelectedValues}
  placeholder="Select technologies"
/>

// With checkboxes and descriptions
<MultiSelect
  options={[
    { 
      value: 'frontend', 
      label: 'Frontend Development',
      description: 'Client-side development',
      icon: 'web'
    }
  ]}
  showChips={true}
  searchable={true}
  clearable={true}
  color="primary"
/>

// Without checkboxes (selected items disappear)
<MultiSelect
  disableCheckboxes={true}
  options={options}
  value={selectedValues}
  onChange={setSelectedValues}
/>
```

### **Autocomplete Component**
Enhanced with state management:

```tsx
import { Autocomplete } from '@acutrack-bookprint/acutrack-ds'

// Basic usage
<Autocomplete
  options={countryOptions}
  value={selectedCountry}
  onChange={setSelectedCountry}
  placeholder="Search countries..."
/>

// With key-based reset for edit forms
<Autocomplete
  key={`autocomplete-${isEditing ? 'edit' : 'view'}-${value}`}
  options={options}
  value={value}
  onChange={onChange}
  isDisabled={!isEditing}
/>
```

### **Form Control Consistency**
All form controls now take full width of their parent containers:

```tsx
// ‚úÖ All components automatically take full width
<div className="w-full">
  <Input placeholder="Full width input" />
  <Select options={options} />
  <MultiSelect options={options} />
  <Autocomplete options={options} />
  <DatePicker />
  <Textarea />
  <ToggleSwitch label="Option" id="option" />
</div>
```

### **Sidebar Component - Toggle Positioning**
Control sidebar toggle button placement:

```tsx
import { Sidebar } from '@acutrack-bookprint/acutrack-ds'

// Toggle at top
<Sidebar
  togglePosition="top"
  showToggleButton={true}
  collapsed={isCollapsed}
>
  {/* Sidebar content */}
</Sidebar>

// Toggle at bottom (default)
<Sidebar
  togglePosition="bottom"
  showToggleButton={true}
  collapsed={isCollapsed}
>
  {/* Sidebar content */}
</Sidebar>

// No toggle button
<Sidebar
  togglePosition="none"
  collapsed={isCollapsed}
>
  {/* Sidebar content */}
</Sidebar>
```

## üîß **Component Defaults**

### **Updated Default Behaviors**
```tsx
// Header - No borders by default
<Header hasBorder={false} /> // Default behavior

// Sidebar - No borders by default  
<Sidebar isBordered={false} /> // Default behavior

// Card - Not full width by default
<Card fullWidth={false} /> // Default behavior

// Grid - Includes xs breakpoint
<Grid cols={{ xs: 1, sm: 2, md: 3 }} /> // Always responsive
```

### **Responsive Layout Components**
```tsx
// Layout adapts to screen size
<Layout isColumn={false}> // flex-col lg:flex-row
  <LayoutSidebar width="md"> {/* w-48 sm:w-56 md:w-64 lg:w-72 */}
    Sidebar content
  </LayoutSidebar>
  <Main>Main content</Main>
</Layout>

// Container scales with screen
<Container size="screen"> {/* max-w-full sm:max-w-screen-lg md:max-w-screen-xl lg:max-w-screen-2xl */}
  Content scales responsively
</Container>
```

## üö® **Critical Fixes Applied**

### **Alert Component Fix**
- ‚úÖ Fixed `containerClasses` undefined error
- ‚úÖ Added fallback variant handling
- ‚úÖ Improved error boundary protection

### **Form Components Fix**
- ‚úÖ Fixed `checked` prop without `onChange` warnings
- ‚úÖ Added proper onChange handlers to Checkbox
- ‚úÖ Ensured all form components have proper event handling
- ‚úÖ **Full-Width Consistency**: All form controls now take full width of parent containers
- ‚úÖ **Dropdown Behavior**: All dropdowns and popovers use full-width behavior

### **Full-Width Form Controls**
All form control components automatically take the full width of their parent containers:

```tsx
// ‚úÖ All components automatically take full width
<div className="w-full">
  <Input ... />           {/* Takes full width */}
  <Select ... />          {/* Takes full width */}
  <MultiSelect ... />     {/* Takes full width */}
  <Autocomplete ... />    {/* Takes full width */}
  <DatePicker ... />      {/* Takes full width */}
</div>
```

**Enhanced Components**:
- **Select**: Updated Dropdown.Content to use `fullWidth={true}`
- **DatePicker**: Added `isFullWidth={true}` to Popover.Content
- **DateRangePicker**: Added `isFullWidth={true}` to Popover.Content
- **EnhancedDatePicker**: Added `isFullWidth={true}` to Popover.Content

### **Responsive Design Fixes**
- ‚úÖ Added missing `xs` breakpoint to Grid
- ‚úÖ Fixed Card `fullWidth` default (now `false`)
- ‚úÖ Enhanced Layout and Container responsiveness
- ‚úÖ Improved mobile-first approach

## üìö **Component Library**

### **Core Components**
- **Layout**: `Layout`, `Container`, `Grid`, `Stack`, `SectionContainer`, `SubSection`
- **Navigation**: `Header`, `Sidebar`, `Breadcrumb`, `Tabs`, `Pagination`, `Stepper`
- **Forms**: `Input`, `Textarea`, `Button`, `Checkbox`, `Radio`, `Select`, `MultiSelect`, `Autocomplete`, `ToggleSwitch`, `Slider`, `NumberInput`, `PasswordInput`, `OTPInput`, `DatePicker`, `DateRangePicker`, `EnhancedDatePicker`, `FileUploader`, `SearchBar`
- **Data**: `Table`, `VirtualizedTable`, `Card`, `Badge`, `Avatar`, `TreeView`, `EmptyState`, `CodeBlock`
- **Feedback**: `Alert`, `Toast`, `Modal`, `Drawer`, `Popover`, `Tooltip`, `Spinner`, `Progress`, `Skeleton`, `Banner`

### **Assets & Branding**
- **Logo Assets**: 9 SVG variants (light/dark themes, full/icon versions, grey variants)
- **Favicon Assets**: Complete favicon set (ICO, SVG, PNG, Apple Touch Icon)
- **Web App Assets**: PWA manifest and icons (192x192, 512x512)
- **Access Methods**: Import URLs, direct asset import, copy to public directory
- **Theme Integration**: Automatic theme-aware logo switching
- **Component Integration**: Built-in support in Header and Sidebar components

### **Component Features Overview (v1.0.68)**

#### **Card Component**
- **Sub-Components**: `Card.Header`, `Card.Body`, `Card.Footer`, `Card.Title`, `Card.Description`, `Card.Actions`, `Card.Content`, `Card.Image`, `Card.Group`
- **Background Colors**: `primary`, `success`, `warning`, `danger`, `info`, `neutral`, `brand-orange`, `brand-navy`, `none`
- **Text Colors**: `primary`, `secondary`, `success`, `warning`, `danger`, `info`, `neutral`, `brand-orange`, `brand-navy`, `white`, `black`, `auto`
- **Gradients**: `primary-to-secondary`, `success-to-info`, `warning-to-danger`, `brand-orange-to-brand-navy`, `rainbow`, `custom`
- **Animations**: `fadeIn`, `slideUp`, `slideDown`, `slideLeft`, `slideRight`, `scale`
- **Loading States**: Skeleton animation with `loading` prop
- **Image Support**: Multiple positions with `imagePosition` prop
- **Overflow Control**: `overflowVisible` prop for dropdown support

#### **Form Components**
- **Input**: Multiple variants, icons, validation, full-width support
- **Select**: Searchable, clearable, full-width dropdowns, **per-option colors** (`primary`, `success`, `warning`, `info`, `danger`/`error`)
- **MultiSelect**: Chips, checkboxes, descriptions, icons, color adaptation
- **Autocomplete**: Type-ahead, create new options, state management
- **DatePicker**: Multiple variants, range selection, enhanced features
- **ToggleSwitch**: Multiple variants, **labelPosition** (`left`, `right`, `top`), controlled/uncontrolled modes
- **All Form Controls**: Consistent full-width behavior, responsive design

#### **Navigation Components**
- **Header**: Multiple variants, themes, search, user menu, responsive
- **Sidebar**: Collapsible groups, themes, responsive, navigation items, `togglePosition` prop (`top`, `bottom`, `none`)
- **Breadcrumb**: Custom separators, responsive sizing
- **Tabs**: Multiple variants, icons, responsive behavior
- **Pagination**: Multiple sizes, responsive controls
- **Stepper**: Step-by-step navigation, validation states

#### **Data Display**
- **Table**: Multiple variants, sorting, filtering, responsive
- **VirtualizedTable**: Large data sets, performance optimized
- **Badge**: Multiple variants, icons, custom colors
- **Avatar**: Multiple sizes, fallbacks, variants
- **TreeView**: Hierarchical data, expandable nodes
- **EmptyState**: Customizable illustrations, actions

#### **Feedback Components**
- **Alert**: Multiple variants, dismissible, icons
- **Toast**: Multiple positions, durations, actions
- **Modal**: Multiple sizes, variants, accessibility
- **Drawer**: Slide-out panels, responsive behavior
- **Progress**: Multiple variants, labels, animations
- **Spinner**: Multiple sizes, custom animations

#### **Button System**
- **Button**: 15+ variants, icons, loading states, responsive
- **ButtonGroup**: Grouped actions, responsive behavior
- **SplitButton**: Primary/secondary actions
- **ThemeToggle**: Light/dark mode switching

### **Assets Usage Examples**

#### **Logo Assets**
```tsx
import { LOGO_URLS, ACUTRACK_LOGO_LIGHT } from '@acutrack-bookprint/acutrack-ds';

// Theme-aware logo
<img src={theme === 'light' ? LOGO_URLS.light.full : LOGO_URLS.dark.full} />

// Direct import
<img src={ACUTRACK_LOGO_LIGHT} alt="Acutrack Logo" />
```

#### **Favicon Assets**
```tsx
import favicon from '@acutrack-bookprint/acutrack-ds/assets/favicon.svg';
import appleTouchIcon from '@acutrack-bookprint/acutrack-ds/assets/apple-touch-icon.png';

// HTML head
<link rel="icon" href={favicon} />
<link rel="apple-touch-icon" href={appleTouchIcon} />
```

#### **Component Integration**
```tsx
<Header logoUrl={LOGO_URLS.light.full} logoAlt="Acutrack Logo" />
<Sidebar logoUrl={LOGO_URLS.light.icon} logoAlt="Acutrack" />
```

## üéØ **Next Steps**
1. **Explore Card Component**: Use the new industry-standard Card sub-components
2. **Implement Form Controls**: Leverage full-width consistency across all form components
3. **Use Option Colors**: Add color states to Select options for better visual feedback (success, warning, error)
4. **Try ToggleSwitch Label Positions**: Use `labelPosition="top"` for vertical form layouts
5. **Configure Sidebar Toggle**: Customize toggle button placement with `togglePosition` prop
6. **Use Advanced Features**: Implement loading states, animations, and gradients
7. **Test Responsive Design**: Ensure proper behavior across all screen sizes
8. **Follow Accessibility**: Use ARIA attributes and semantic HTML structure
9. **Leverage Iconography**: Use the comprehensive icon system for consistent UI patterns
